docs.snippet: The number of people reported arrested during a demonstration in favor of captured drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman rose to 211 Monday, as outrage grew over what some fear is the glorification of a man considered the hemisphere's most powerful ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of people reported arrested during a demonstration in favor of captured drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman rose to 211 Monday, as outrage grew over what some fear is the glorification of a man considered the hemisphere's most powerful trafficker.

headline.main: Arrests Rise in March for Jailed Mexican Drug Lord
headline.print_headline: Arrests Rise in March for Jailed Mexican Drug Lord

docs.snippet: A leader of the Venezuelan opposition called Monday for citizens to begin organizing committees that could sustain the pressure that continuing street protests have placed on the socialist government of President Nicolas Maduro....

headline.main: Venezuelan Opposition to Organize at Grassroots

docs.abstract: Mike Hale reviews police procedural television series Those Who Kill, starring Chloe Sevigny, on A&E.

docs.snippet: The collapse of Mt. Gox and and the loss of $450 million in Bitcoins is pushing governments to enhance regulation of virtual currencies, the author writes....
docs.abstract: The collapse of Mt. Gox and and the loss of $450 million in Bitcoins is pushing governments to enhance regulation of virtual currencies, the author writes.

headline.main: Bitcoin Loss Highlights Elusive Paths of Regulation

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court indicated Monday that states should look beyond an intelligence test score in borderline cases of mental disability to determine whether a death row inmate is eligible to be executed....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court indicated Monday that states should look beyond an intelligence test score in borderline cases of mental disability to determine whether a death row inmate is eligible to be executed.

headline.main: Court Skeptical of IQ Scores in Deciding Execution
headline.print_headline: Court Skeptical of IQ Scores in Deciding Execution

docs.snippet: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa, the new chief creative officer at Archie Comic Publications, has a long history with comics and Archie, some of it bumpy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa, the new chief creative officer at Archie Comic Publications, has a long history with comics and Archie, some of it bumpy.
docs.abstract: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa is new chief creative officer at Archie Comic Publications; Aguirre-Sacasa, who has written for film and television, is tasked with figuring out how best to exploit company's characters in comics, as well as in other media.

headline.main: Archie Comic Picks Film and TV Writer for Top Creative Post
headline.print_headline: Archie Comic Picks Film and TV Writer for Top Creative Post

docs.snippet: Amplify, part of News Corporation, is one of many companies releasing all-digital curriculums for sale to school districts....
docs.lead_paragraph: Amplify, part of News Corporation, is one of many companies releasing all-digital curriculums for sale to school districts.
docs.abstract: Several companies are preparing English language curriculums built entirely on digital platforms, promising to change the nature of classroom learning across the country; products would replace textbooks, worksheets or printed study guides.

headline.main: New All-Digital Curriculums Hope to Ride High-Tech Push in Schoolrooms
headline.print_headline: New All-Digital Curriculums Hope to Ride High-Tech Push in Schoolrooms
